outlier which may also explain the relatively low improvement rate.
Financial data ( Figure II-1 ) seem to show little relation of effect with financial resources. At 
the lower end of resources the Vietnam figure does not include local costs, and (as above) the 
Indonesia figure may be an underestimate. While most programmes probably require a minimum 
of US$ 10/child per year to show impact, how the funds are used may be more important than 
the amount per child.
